name: A Great and Mighty Wonder
summary: The people who heard the shepherds’ testimony were filled with wonder. Wonder is a sense of amazement. It can be defined as “a feeling of surprise mingled with admiration, caused by something beautiful, unexpected, unfamiliar, or inexplicable.” Even though the cultural celebration of Christmas has a tendency to take away the sheer shock value of the gospel narratives, nevertheless the accounts themselves are so amazing that we can come back to them year after year and sense something of how awestruck Mary, Joseph, the shepherds and wise men must have been. And yet, as amazing as the angelic appearances were, as shocking as the news of a virgin bearing a child was, it was the message about the child that astonished these people.
